titleStmt.title: Virginia and Maryland, or, The Lord Baltamore's printed case, uncased and answered shewing the illegality of his patent and usurpation of royal jurisdiction and dominion there : with the injustice and tyranny practised against ... adventurers and planters : also a short relation of the papists late rebellion against the government of His Highness the Lord Protector ... : to which is added a brief account of the commissioners proceedings in the reducing of Maryland ...
titleStmt.author: Baltimore, Cecil Calvert, Baron, ca. 1605-1675.

publicationStmt.publisher: And are to be sold at the Crown ...,

notesStmt.note: A contribution to the controversy between Lord Baltimore and the Puritan element among his colonists, being an answer to a tract published in 1653 entitled: The Lord Baltamore's case concerning the province of Maryland. Cf. Winsor, Nar. and crit. hist., v. 3, p. 554.
Reproduction of original in Huntington Library.
